XIII.i.2.A.6.a
.
Payment if the Vehicle Was Purchased Before Adjudicative Action Established Eligibility
Ordinarily, an application on
VA Form 21-4502
is completed and approved by the authorization activity to certify eligibility before the claimant takes possession of, or title to, the vehicle.
However, payment of the automobile allowance is
not
precluded if the vehicle was purchased before the adjudicative action establishing eligibility, provided the claimant was actually eligible on the date on which the claimant signed the sales contract.  The claimant’s eligibility is controlled by the effective date of the qualifying disability.
title: M21-1, Part XIII, Subpart i, Chapter 2, Section A - Automobile and Adaptive Equipment Allowance Under 38 U.S.C. Chapter 39
